meanings.definition: The practice or system of white domination in South Africa during the apartheid era.
meanings.sent1: During apartheid, baaskaps allowed white people to control everything.
meanings.sent2: The legacy of baaskaps still affects South Africa today.
meanings.sent3: Some people thought baaskaps was a good idea, but it caused a lot of harm.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of baaskaps loomed over the country for many years.
meanings.sent5: The concept of baaskaps is a dark chapter in history.

meanings.definition: The attitude or behavior of a person who believes they are superior to others based on their race.
meanings.sent1: His baaskaps made him treat others unfairly because of their race.
meanings.sent2: She displayed her baaskaps by looking down on people who were different from her.
meanings.sent3: His baaskaps was so extreme that he thought he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent4: The poison of baaskaps poisoned relationships and communities.
meanings.sent5: Her baaskaps blinded her to the beauty of diversity.
